comment: This whisky was voted the wold' best blended whisky in 2012 by Whisky Magazine. Not sure I agree. Better than Johnie Walker Red or Famous Grouse for sure, but a JW Black or Double Black runs rings around it. Very good value at $10 locally though.
Woe is me for buying such rubbish! It may be peated, but it shall not be repeated.
Just discovered it in Montreal honestly my new go to for as long as the SAQ can keep the shelves stacked.

Nose - Peat (iodine, plasters), banana, green apple, pear, vanilla cream.
Palate - Rich vanilla, dried fruit.
Finish - Medium, vanilla, and fruit sweetness.
43% ABV

The best whisky under 200 ZAR.
